meanings.definition: The act of closing or shutting something
meanings.sent1: I heard the closure of the door as my brother left the room.
meanings.sent2: Please ensure the closure of all windows before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The closure of the book marked the end of the story.
meanings.sent4: The closure of the store signified the end of business hours.
meanings.sent5: The closure of the gate kept the animals safe inside.

meanings.definition: A feeling of resolution or finality
meanings.sent1: Finding closure after a breakup can be challenging.
meanings.sent2: The closure of the case brought relief to the victim's family.
meanings.sent3: She finally found closure after receiving an apology.
meanings.sent4: The closure of the chapter left readers eager for the next one.
meanings.sent5: The closure of the deal was celebrated with a handshake.

meanings.definition: A sense of comfort or relief after a difficult experience
meanings.sent1: The closure she felt after the exam was immense.
meanings.sent2: The closure of the therapy session brought a sense of peace.
meanings.sent3: His closure came in the form of a warm hug from a friend.
meanings.sent4: The closure of the project allowed for a well-deserved break.
meanings.sent5: The closure of the meeting left everyone feeling reassured.
